alert.note: Alert for Chautauqua (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued December 23 at 6:25PM EST until December 25 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Buffalo
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM EST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions and heavy lake effect snow. Additional snow accumulations of 10 to 20 inches. Winds gusting as high as 70 mph. Wind chills as low as 25 below zero. * WHERE...Chautauqua county. The heaviest snow amounts and worst blowing snow will be along the Lake Erie shore. * WHEN...Until 7 AM EST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Areas of blowing snow will produce near zero visibility. Very strong winds could cause extensive tree damage and power outages. The dangerously cold wind chills as low as 25 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: Strong winds will cause significant blowing and drifting snow, frequently reducing visibilities to zero. Travel is strongly discouraged.
